New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers improved to 14-0, the longest winning streak in club history, and became the sixth team in league history to win its first 14 games.
The 14-game winning streak is the longest in club history — the Cavs had three 13-gamers with LeBron James on the roster.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points, including 18 in the fourth quarter, to put away the Bulls.
Substitute Caris LeVert and Mitchell both hit 3-pointers as the Cavs closed with a 21-7 flurry.
The Cavs went on what has become known as a ‘Cav-a-lanche’ in recent years.
Pre-Game Insights: First-year coach Kenny Atkinson has pushed every correct button while dipping deep into his bench each game.
Atkinson has made the Cavs even better by buying into an up-tempo offensive system designed around spacing, 3-pointers and ball movement.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs are winning selflessly, with players like Mitchell sensing what the team needs right now.
Atkinson isn't letting his team be satisfied, and is continuing to coach hard and not let any lapses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs celebrated their win by dancing on the Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse court with a giant green frog, who has quickly become an impromptu mascot.
The frog has been seen on the streets outside the arena and has become a vibe in the city.
